author: Dailymail Reporter
title: Paris Jackson dons shirt with her late father's name | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share The privileged teenager went full-on comfy as she added a pair of tan UGG boots to her laid-back ensemble and only carried her keys and cell phone in hand. She showed off her natural beauty going make-up free and pulled her short blonde tresses back into a ponytail. Laid-back look: The 18-year-old went braless in the ripped vintage top while outside a friend's house in Los Angeles. She teamed the look with colorful pajama pants and UGG boots This comes just as Michael's only daughter added two new tattoos to the mix earlier on Sunday. She took to her Instagram story to film the experience at the tattoo shop. Along with her best friend, Prudence Brando, Paris inked 'stay north' behind one of her ears as well as another near the side of her rib. New ink: Earlier on Sunday, Paris took to her Instagram story to film herself getting two new tattoos with the phrase: 'stay north' 'Stay north': She dedicated her tattoos (one behind her ear and the other on her ribcage) to her late friend, Natalie, who passed away. She now has over 50 tattoos Tribute: She posted a sweet message early Sunday morning to her late friend While the meaning of the tattoo is unclear, it appeared to have been related to the star's friend, Natalie, who passed away according to Paris' latest Instagram picture. The actress-model captioned her tattoo post: 'This is for you nat,' after sharing a sweet tribute to her friend early Sunday morning. Earlier in February, Paris took the stage during the Grammy Awards to call her Thriller hit-maker father a 'legend', before quoting one of his famous poems to the crowd in a touching tribute. On stage: Earlier in February, Paris spoke during the Grammy Awards to call her hit-maker father a 'legend', before quoting one of his famous poems to the crowd in a touching tribute All glammed up! Paris looked gorgeous as she hit the red carpet ahead of the annual award show in Los Angeles Swapping her red carpet gown for a cut-out tie dye number, the young stunner truly dazzled as she confidently introduced The Weeknd and Daft Punk's performance of I Feel It Coming at the bash. Welcoming the artists on stage, she began: 'A legend once said that a star can never die, it just turns into a smile and melts back into the cosmic music, the dance of life.' The inspiring quote came from Michael's book of reflective poetry Dancing The Dream, released in 1992 - making her pop star father the 'legend' in her heartwarming onstage tribute. Michael died on June 25, 2009. Flashback: Michael Jackson died on June 25, 2009. He performed during World Music Awards 2006 in London
